snippet: Leaders of Syria’s rebellion say that by sitting on the sidelines, the West risks losing a potential ally in the Middle East if President Bashar al-Assad’s government falls.
abstract: Leaders of Syria’s rebellion, enraged by what they call the inaction and hypocrisy of powerful nations, say that by sitting on the sidelines, the West risks losing a potential Middle Eastern ally if Pres Bashar al-Assad’s government falls.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of Syria’s rebellion say that by sitting on the sidelines, the West risks losing a potential ally in the Middle East if President Bashar al-Assad’s government falls.
